intro: Draba chionophila, commonly known as the snow hill draba, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This low-growing species typically reaches heights of less than 10 centimeters and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Draba chionophila is often found in mountainous areas where it blooms in late spring or early summer.
